results.title: Network
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Paddy Chayefsky, Howard Gottfried and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Sidney Lumet’s “Network” is a dead-on indictment of the TV news media which seems to be growing more relevant with each passing year. Howard Beale is the long-time news anchor for the UBS-TV News. When ratings go down, Beale is fired and suffers an on-air breakdown, announcing that he is going to commit suicide on his final programme. Ironically, his angry rantings boost his ratings - much to the surprise and delight of UBS executives. Subsequently, Beale is re-hired and re-invented as the “mad prophet of the airwaves” and soon becomes a pawn of ruthless programming executives who milk his madness for every share point it’s worth. When the “prophet” ceases to be popular and profitable however, something must be done about Beale, preferably on camera, before a live audience. Cast includes: Faye Dunaway, William Holden, Peter Finch, Robert Duvall, Wesley Addy, Beatrice Straight and Ned Beatty.

results.title: Netsilik Eskimo: Fishing at the Stone Weir. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In this film, it is full summer. The skin tents are up, and it is time to fish. The men go into the river to form enclosures to trap fish. Once trapped, they are speared with three-pronged leisters. A woman cleans the catch, which has been strung on a thong. Everyone enjoys bits of raw fish. Film without words.

results.title: Netball: the Australian way
results.creator_credit: All Australian Netball Association and Production Group
results.brief_description: This film provides a comprehensive guide to netball and is directed at teachers, student teachers and coaches giving practical advice on skills and training. The need for a coach to have a caring attitude towards the player is stressed throughout. Topics include: the game; successful coaching; coaching and learning skills; basic skills; skills practices; tactics; strategies and matchplay and planning a training program.

results.title: Netball Catch 'n' Play
results.creator_credit: Colin Pym, Video Classroom and Colin Pym Productions
results.brief_description: A “Life Be In It” resource for junior netballers. It provides warm-up activities, skills, modified games and basic rules in a simple yet informative way.

results.title: Nests in the bush
results.brief_description: A classroom film for young children on how different Australian birds build and conceal their nests and rear their young. Yellow robin, wren, loterill, honey-eater and wagtail are among those seen.
results.description: A classroom film for young children on how different Australian birds build and conceal their nests and rear their young. Yellow robin, wren, loterill, honey-eater and wagtail are among those seen.

results.title: Nest Web Cocoon
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media
results.brief_description: A nature study film showing a bird (bottle-swallow) nesting, a spider (Golden Orb) building its web, and a caterpillar (gum emperor moth) making a cocoon. No narration.
results.description: A nature study film showing a bird (bottle-swallow) nesting, a spider (Golden Orb) building its web, and a caterpillar (gum emperor moth) making a cocoon. No narration.

results.title: Nervous systems in animals
results.brief_description: All living organisms respond to stimuli and even uni-cellular animals can make such reactions although their means of co-ordination are not known. Examining the neuron structure of multi-cellular hydra, planarians, annelids, various insects, fish, birds, amphibians and mammals, their nervous systems are exposed by micro-photography and dissection.

results.title: Nervous system. - 3rd. edition.
results.brief_description: Includes some of the first micrographs ever to show nerve cells in the act of sending and receiving impulses. Explains the complex physiology of the central and peripheral nervous systems and their parts. Identifies certain foods and drugs that have a variety of effects on the nervous system.

results.title: Nervous system in man
results.brief_description: Shows interlocking of effects of endocrine and nervous systems. Illustrates the types of nerve cells, and processes of impulse transmission. Discusses the diseases of the nervous system. From the Human Physiology Series.
